There‚Äôs obviously still a lot we don‚Äôt know. I‚Äôm going to continue pushing for transparency so Americans know what‚Äôs going on in the skies above their country.

Newer technology has allowed for more detection in recent years.

UAPs weren‚Äôt detected before because our radars were not adjusted for slow-moving objects.

Why are we just now seeing them? Heightened surveillance means we‚Äôre tracking more objects. These objects passed near DOD facilities, & posed a danger to commercial aircraft‚Äîwhy they were shot down. (China balloon posed no threat to civilian aircraft, because it was above 60k ft)

The UAPs were in FAA commercial zones and had no signals or navigation lights.

The first two UAPs were smaller, the size of an ATV, and harder to detect. The third resembled a balloon, and was easier for the radar to pick up.

All moved with wind currents.

We still don‚Äôt know what these other 3 objects were. We‚Äôre calling them unidentified aerial phenomenons (UAPs). 

We knew exactly what the China spy balloon was, and immediate steps were taken to stop its data from being sent to China.

‚û°Ô∏è  Modify U.S. law to allow families to be held together safely for longer than the 20 days currently allowed by the Flores decision, and require families to be processed swiftly as priority cases.
